title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 6190.3 - NYS accreditation standards
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 6190.3 - NYS accreditation standards

State Regulations
(a) The commission has determined that all
forensic laboratories must meet the following standards to receive NYS
accreditation in disciplines other than forensic DNA testing: (1)
the laboratory must be accredited by
ANAB; or
(2)
if the laboratory is
performing only toxicology analysis, it must be accredited by either ANAB or
ABFT. (b) The commission
has further determined, upon the binding recommendation of the DNA
subcommittee, that any forensic laboratory performing forensic DNA testing must
be accredited by ANAB to include forensic DNA testing, and must comply with all
conditions of the FBI's Quality Assurance Standards. (c) Once a forensic laboratory has been
accredited by ANAB or ABFT using mock cases, the commission may receive and
review the results of the mock cases. Notes

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
